metadata.title: USN-6393-1 -- ImageMagick vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ImageMagick did not properly handle memory when processing the -help option. An attacker could potentially use this issue to cause a crash.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6393-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 imagemagick-doc - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagickwand-dev - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagick++-dev - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 libmagickcore-dev - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
